no.hig.hers.ludoserver

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.hig.hers.ludoserver.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player objects that are created when a new server connection is accpeted. Also handles the check if the one trying to connect with a username and passord exits in the database or wants too create a new user in the database Author Petter on 03.11.2015

      Sets the connection and input and output from the server socket

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Non blocking read from the client, if no data is available then null will be returned. Checks to see if a line can be read from the client and if so reads and returns that line (message). If no message is available null is returned.
        Returns:
        a String with message if available, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading

      • loginChecker

        public boolean loginChecker(int serverPort)
        The function read from the input two messages. Then it goes threw several if, else if's to check what the message contains. If the message contains the correct keyword the message data will then be checked against the database. If the database accept the info. A message go ahead or you can't message will be sent back to the one trying to log in.
        Parameters:
        serverPort - The port that the new player uses
        Returns:
        true or false

      • sendPlayerList

        public void sendPlayerList(Chat chat)
        Method for sending a player the playerlist for a specific chat.
        Parameters:
        chat - The chat to get the playerlist from.

      • sendTopTenLists

        public void sendTopTenLists()
        Method for sending a player the top ten played and won lists. First retrieves it from the server, then sends the lists one by one line.

      • sendPlayerScores

        public void sendPlayerScores()
        Method for sending a player his win and played scores. First retrieves it from the DatabaseHandler, then sends it.
